title: If you want to nerf Morgana in the support role, you are doing it wrong.
body:
**TL;DR I want to be able to play Morgana in the mid lane, as she was originally intended.  I don't really care for support Morgana and agree that she might be a bit too strong.**

Morgana doesn't use Tormented Soil for damage in the support role -- she uses it to tag people for assists and to spend Spellthief's Edge stacks.

By removing early damage from Tormented Soil, Morgana will be pushed in more easily in the mid lane.  Her wave clear was already abysmal, taking many seconds to work whereas other champions can instantly clear a wave.  If you are against a champion that instantly cleared waves, then chances are the enemy minions would walk off of your soil forcing you to tank the minion wave and spend another 130 mana dropping another patch of soil.

The best way to nerf Morgana's supportive capabilities is to remove the interaction between Spellthief's Edge and Tormented Soil.  Make it so that it doesn't spend all three stacks in one cast.  That way, Morgana spends more mana constantly dropping soil OR has to blow her binding, providng a significant moment of weakness for the next 11 seconds.

An alternative to the above can be buffing Black Shield's cooldown to 15 seconds, giving it an offensive use (aka, use it on an enemy to spend the cooldown and do some damage/effect.)  Have the cooldown doubled to 30 seconds if you use it to shield an ally.  The shield duration can also be shorted to 3 or 4 seconds, if needed.

replies.body: Nerfing her tormented soil damage is pretty much the least effective way to hurt her support game. I'd much rather see her Binding spamming cut down on, maybe increase the mana cost and give a refund on champ or minion hit.

I would love this.  Make the binding cooldown slightly longer too, and refund say 25% to 50% of it on hit.  A 15 second cd binding would be very punishing to miss but hitting it allows you to cast one 7.5 seconds later.

I'm not sure if that's the right way to handle it.

As far as I'm concerned, so long as her Q and her E remain how they are she will be popular in bot lane, especially when CC Tank supports are run frequently as well as the rest of the supports being mainly AP/magic damage focused. Landing one binding potentially destroys a nontank support, and Black Shield removes CC threat if you are able to use it right before (or during a CC train) spells are used. She is a mushroom while other supports fit into a rock, paper, scissors (Tank<Sustain<Poke<Tank) set up.

You'd have to either change her kit interaction with CC or reduce the amount of CC she has in her kit while also increasing AP ratios to encourage her going to mid. Sadly mid has a bunch of AD and Assassins and easier jungle interaction, and while she can fair well there, it isn't exactly in her best interest as an immobile, magic shielding mage unless she knows she's going up against another mage or can reliably land her CC and use her shield properly (which is a player related problem, not entirely a champion).

And as a support main, while she's annoying I don't really want her leaving the lane entirely. Her presence makes CC train tanks less of a problem and more manageable.

Yeah I played a game as Leona vs Sivir/Morgana. Even ignoring her Q, her black shield combined with Sivir's spell shield meant I was struggling to land a single stun on Sivir the entire laning phase. For a supposed midlaner Morgana's ability to negate CC effects make her too damn useful in bot lane to ever completely leave. That being said, does she still cleanse upon shielding her target? Because I know her shield used to remove all CC already on the target, which is an interaction I really don't like.

> That being said, does she still cleanse upon shielding her target?

Nope. It will prevent application of CC (and it will prevent application of a CC if that CC spell also breaks the shield), but it will never remove existing CC.

Sivir and Morg vs Leona. You got counterpicked hard. There's pretty much nothing Leona can do to that lane unless they screw up.
To be fair, Morgana and Sivir are the [two hardest counters to Leona](http://champion.gg/champion/Leona/Support). Sounds more like you got counterplayed in champ select...

Oh yeah they picked it to screw me over, but my point being is that Leona is super popular, and Morgana is a great counter because of her black shield, and until one of those things changes she's not leaving bot lane.

There are 2 changes that could be made to balance support Morg.

1.) Make it not count every tick of Tormented Soil for Spellthief's Edge. As it stands, you absolutely cannot stop her from getting every single stack of Spellthief's all game because she gets 3 instantly before you can even react.

2.) Reduce the width of her Q. I understand the length is integral to the rest of her kit so it needs to stay somewhat, but that thing is just too damn long.

Lulu was created to be a support though... They nerfed her solo laning because she wasn't made for that. To complain about nerfing a champion that was designed to support out of being anything but support is asinine. Morgana was made to be an AP carry and did a great job at doing such, but still has the old issues. This is just a straight nerf to her laning when she's not even considered amazing in a solo lane right now. It's not even a nerf to her support like it's aimed at doing.

This nerf is the equivalent of nerfing Soraka's E's damage at earlier stages or changing the AoE damage of Jayce's hammer W. It's not going to be noticed by the people they're intending on hitting.

They've always tried to help mid laners keep their mid lane ability, like when they nerfed Annie's base on her Q, W, and R, but incredibly increased her ratios on each such abilities. Its a jungle nerf.. if you dont believe me .. try her out in the jungle before the nerf happens.

If Torment Soil was the problem the easier fix would easily be  change the cost of it from 70/85/100/115/130 mana to +40 Per level(Hence 110/125/140/155/170) (then apply a 10 Mana refund on killing minions with Soil) - less spamable -> less gold gain ability without killing off mid Morgana(well kills off mid until she hits lvl 5) This implies that spellthief edge is a problem( if it is one, I personally don't care, I havn't seen a Morgana support in awhile so I'm not sure how much this effects the game) 

If Dark binding is the problem then decreasing max range on Q or rescale the root duration from 2 / 2.25 / 2.5 / 2.75 / 3 to something like 1.50 / 1.75 / 2 / 2.5 / 3. Making a CD refund on hit(Thresh Treatment) isn't as effective since anyone who plays Morgana effectly won't change anything. (the spike is from 3-5, and not 1-2 thus reducing extremely early snowballing) 

Or if the random problem is the Black Shield, decreasing the duration from 5->4 and increasing the shield or other way around(decrease power of shield to increase duration)
There are ways to effectively nerf someone without having to completely butcher them. You just need to identify whats the problem.

And all of this is implied IF Morgana needed a nerf to begin with.
